instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No CPU VCORE
threads.message:
This board had multiple small spots of liquid contact in these areas, most were minor and just noticeable liquid but looks not significant corrosion to solder joint/pad: <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>/20/30 (minor), CB701 (corroded and replaced), <RESISTOR>R4922</RESISTOR> Corroded and replaced, TPB206 pad is gone, <CHIP>U8110</CHIP> (minor) , above <CHIP>U8800</CHIP> (minor), UA870 (minor), 

<SIGNAL>PVCCIO_PGOOD</SIGNAL> is 1.7V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 1.8V
Major coils show voltage except: PPVCCGT phase1/2, cPU CORE 1/2/3,and bklight coil

THis mac will show in DFU mode and tried both revive/restore: Apple Controller not booted

Board starts from both charger or battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No CPU VCORE
threads.message:
VCCGT will not appear until high graphics load is detected.
VCORE must appear on boot, of course.
Bad news about liquid sign near VCORE power supply.
CPU can be damaged now.

PCH, T2 (including BIOS) and CPU itself, all are involved in VCORE generating.
You may have corroded trace, or component, accumulated crap under some BGA chip.
